title: Why is Germany against globalisation, even though there a big economy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Strange question, because German products are popular globally. They have established factories and offices all around the world. They are global market leaders in many areas. List of companies of Germany - Wikipedia From German Silicon Valley Innovators Inc."German Silicon Valley Innovators Inc. is the Innovation Outpost for all German „Mittelstand” and Corporations, which has a deep and fundamental interest in Innovation and the Startup Ecosystem of Silicon Valley. We offer German companies tailor-made access to Silicon Valley’s Startup and Innovation Ecosystem. We enable our customers to take advantage of the local network as well as the experiences and opportunities Silicon Valley provides. To ensure sustainable success of our customers, we believe that only high-quality services can enable innovation progress and fundamental changes in long-standing companies, like most of our customers. Thus, we tailor our services according to and in consultation with our customers’ needs and objectives." More about German Silicon Valley Innovators Inc.

Germany, like many other countries lately, has been shifting to a nationalistic stance. It’s an easy way to blame all of a country’s problems on someone else, rather than their own past choices. Some subset of the population or some other country or some organization is much easier to blame than accepting their own responsibility.
